nodes.text: You receive an email claiming to be from your bank asking you to verify your account details. The email looks official but something feels off.

evidence.label: Urgency level
evidence.text: Account will be suspended in 24 hours

effects.feedback: Never click links in suspicious emails
Excellent! Always verify through official channels
Safe choice, but reporting is better

nodes.text: The link took you to a fake website that looks like your bank's login page. You realize this is a phishing attempt.

effects.feedback: Never enter credentials on suspicious sites
Good recovery! You recognized the threat

nodes.text: The bank confirms this was a phishing attempt. They thank you for reporting it and confirm your account is secure.
IT security confirms this was a phishing attempt and has blocked the sender. Your quick reporting helped protect others.
You safely deleted the email, but consider reporting suspicious emails to help protect your colleagues.

effects.feedback: Safe but could be more proactive

nodes.text: Well done! You successfully identified and handled a phishing attempt. This is the foundation of good cybersecurity awareness.
Unfortunately, you fell for the phishing attempt. This is a learning opportunity - always verify suspicious communications through official channels.
